description.narrative: Kärnstödet är avsett för impl.av AWIDS stategiska plan 2013-2017. Målet är bl a att skapa en stark global kvinnorättsrörelse samt påverka givare och andra aktörer att stärka sitt stöd för kvinnors rättigheter. AWID fokusomr är: 1) att utmana religiös fundamentalism; 2) stärka ekonomisk rättvisa & fin.för kvinn rättigh 3)rätten att kunna försvara sina rättigheter; kv MR försvarar

Sida provides core support for implementation of AWID's strategic plan 2013-2016. The goal is to strengthen women's rights (WR) org and to influence donors and other actors to support women's rights movements. AWID's focus areas are; 1)challenging religious fundamentalisms 2) Ec justice & fin. for WR 3) Women human rights defenders.

description.narrative: AWID's reports throughout the years show achievements in all relevant areas and this is also the case with the last narrative report that marks the end of the strategic plan. The result register 2017, contains results that go back to 2013. The most significant results are that AWID has built on the momentum of the 2016 Forum and strengthened diverse feminist organizing and cross-movement collaboration. For example, with partners, they have put women's rights at the centre of negotiations on a binding treaty for corporate accountability and coordinated joint demands through the Feminist for a Binding Treat (F4BT) group. AWID's involvement in the Count Me In! Consortium from 2016-2020 as a joint resource mobilization model as well as among women's rights organizations who are also engaging collaborative program work pooling expertise, experiences and partners to strengthen advocacy abilities of grassroots organisations is also an example. Another example concerns the increase of visibility of women's rights organisations and issues within influential spaces and institutions. For example, AWID mobilised their diverse membership and broader constituencies to take action in defence of WHRDs under threat, and facilitated connections between WHRDs and international mandate holders such as Special rapporteurs and UN Working Group on Discrimination against Women. This has led to greater collective support on the ground, and has also brought individual cases to the international level to push for response. AWID have also raised the visibility of feminist and women's rights organising in the mainstream media through various platforms, including the women's rights and gender equality in focus section of the Guardian's global development portal - and https://www.opendemocracy.net/5050 - publishing stories and voices that wouldn't usually get featured. AWID has also informed and equipped their members and constituency through webinars, publications, social media and creative resources. They have particularly increased their use of art and other forms of creative expression to reach people. For example, they mention the report and webinar on Challenging corporate power; OURs 2017 Trends Report; WHRDs Confronting Extractive Industries; the video and practical guide outlining forms of action and resistance against extractive industries; the policy brief on "Illicit Financial Flows"; 12 illustrations of the Movements Matter digital visual arts series; and two short animations produced from from the creative illustrations at the Forum: the State of our Feminist Movements and Climate and Environmental Justice. Collaborative advocacy is also another example raised with allies that has contributed to quality funding for women's rights and gender justice; inflicting funder thinking; and introducing feminist perspectives to financing for development. For example, they have successfully helped advocate for Canada's landmark "Feminist International Assistance Policy", which include the creation of a historic fund for women's right in the global South, and they are also mobilising their members to provide recommendations for and monitor implementation of the Spotlight Initiative and its EUR million to end violence against women and girls.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
